R4.4: Percent of eligible water containers treated with chemical larval source management

description.narrative: 80% due to allowance of some households possibly declining the intervention

comment.narrative: The high temperature and humidity in Aden during the first few months of the project (summer season) led to difficulties in finding water containers that were positive for mosquito pupae that could have been collected. In addition, as became apparent during the first entomological survey, people store their water in small jerry cans and water buckets rather than larger water containers, such as water drums. The SumiLarv 2MR disks can only be used in water containers of 40L upwards. While mosquitoes still breed in jerry cans and water buckets, these reciprocals are not suitable for the 2MR disks. The entomological team will continue to search for suitable water containers during the wetter season of the year.

title.narrative: Result 3: The target population is accessing sustainable safe water for drinking and other relevant uses
R3-3.1: # people using basic or limited drinking water services

description.narrative: Basic drinking water services: According to Indikit.net, basic drinking water is that from an improved source provided collection time is not more than 30 minutes for a roundtrip including queuing). Limited water service is from an improved source where fetching time exceeds 30min . Out of gross popln 60,000 targeted, at least 85% or 51,000 are reached of who 8,400 or 16% of 51,000 will get water at doorstep; balance of 42,600 through water points, some accessible within 500m and 30min and some varyingly beyond 500m and 30min. This is because population density in rural areas is sparse and it may not always be feasible to find a good water source. However, even a comparatively long walking distance to a new and safe water source would still be a health boost to them for the very first time in their lives. The figure of 42,600 added to 8,400 (R3.3.2 below) adds to 51,000 pple.

SO2: % of target population accessing sustainable safe environmental sanitation

description.narrative: Sustainable means resilient to weather elements and coping well in adverse situations; has foreseeable lifespan of 10-15 years; is environment friendly; utilizes local materials, skill and knowledge capacities. Safe: means structurally, psychologically and culturally sound, hazard free, as well as dignifying and acceptable. Accessible: Means is available in adequate quantities and quality, by all (including easy access for differently abled persons) most of the time, within reasonable reach (distance) and affordable cost Environmental sanitation means sanitation that is cognizant of public health benefits but also hazards; it is environmentally friendly, and climate change sensitive. It also highlights the opportunity to to reuse, to reduce and to recycle waste, and to dispose what cannot be disposed safely. In this context, at least 80% of population will benefit from latrines and/or solid waste disposal services (vector control is treated separately and Result 4).

title.narrative: Result 3: The target population is accessing sustainable safe water for drinking and other relevant uses
R3-3.4.2: % WUA – Water User Associations who are judged by their target beneficiaries as managing their WS effectively.

description.narrative: WUA-Water User Association (7-9 members) are selected/elected by the community to manage a water facility normally a community water supply or water point. The term water facility is preferred for this project to cater for school water supplies which would be managed by school management committee and public health unit water supplies managed by the Health Facility Administration. Effective: means in the context of the project that the committee has a constitution, meets regularly with membership of the committee including men and women. It is generally as diverse as possible. The committee is trained and linked to local water authority. It has an engaged operator/ undertaker to run the water service on full time basis. It has a functional water tariff mechanism in plaace. The service is regular reliable and reliable, with less than 72hrs down time in the event of a breakdown, which shall be communicated to consumers timely.

comment.narrative: During the reporting period MI DPAs visited 8,800 households each week with new health messages for a total of 12 weeks (3rd of July - 8th of September). 55,012 individual community members were reached through the DPA activities. The remaining community members will be added to the total indicator target through visiting different households during the grant extension period.

title.narrative: Result 4: Due to IEC campaigns and appropriate chemical larval source management, the target population shows reduced disease vectors at household and community level
R4.1 Number of Disease Prevention Assistants (DPAs) trained in delivering vector borne disease prevention and health messaging interventions

comment.narrative: The number of DPAs to train had to be adapted. In the context of the Covid-19 epidemic, the training of 430 DPAs represented a real challenge for MI. To mitigate the risk of spreading the virus during the upcoming DPA sessions with households, MI eventually trained 91 DPAs and strengthened their training by extending their duration from one day to four days per week, but reaching the same number of community memebers as 430 DPAs would have. Among them, one was absent on the 2nd day of the training and two stopped the work due to personal reasons, so MI is currently employing 88 DPAs. This reduced setup also lowers the costs and logistics associated with training and reduce the overall training period before implementation. At last, as the they are more closely invested in the project, DPAs are more motivated.
